reasoning.correctness: The Generated Answer accurately reports the productive cough resolving after 4-5 days, persistent cough for 2 weeks, transition to dry cough, and chest soreness/pain when coughing excessively, all matching the Gold Answer and transcript. Minor discrepancy in labeling 'chest hurts a little bit' and 'sore' as 'Chest Pain' without noting it is not independent chest pain, but core facts are consistent without contradictions.
reasoning.completeness: Key points from Gold Answer covered: resolved productive cough with whitish clear mucus for first 4-5 days [P-6]; persistent cough for 2 weeks [P-2]; dry cough since day 4-5 [P-6]; chest soreness with excessive coughing [P-15]. Key points missed: resolved sore throat for first 2-3 days [P-13]; resolved runny nose in first couple days [P-14]; early 'flu symptoms' resolved in 3-4 days except cough [P-14]; cough details like 3-4 times/hour [P-9], spontaneous/no triggers [P-10], stable intensity [P-7] and frequency [P-8]; pertinent negatives (no difficulty breathing [P-11], no fevers [P-12], no nausea/vomiting [P-19], no abdominal pain [P-20]). Covers ~30% of key points.
reasoning.faithfulness: All claims in Generated Answer are directly verifiable in the transcript with accurate citations: productive cough/mucus [P-6], persistent cough [P-2], dry cough transition [P-6], chest pain/soreness when coughing [P-15]. No hallucinations or unverifiable details.
reasoning.relevance: The Generated Answer directly addresses the question by categorizing symptoms into 'Resolved Symptoms' and 'Symptoms Still Present' with specific details from the transcript, containing no off-topic content.

summary: The Generated Answer is factually accurate and faithful to the transcript but significantly incomplete in covering resolved symptoms like sore throat and runny nose, as well as detailed characteristics of the ongoing cough.
